trans-unit.source: Starting the Network Server from a Java application

seg-source.mrk: Starting the Network Server from a Java application

target.mrk: Starting the Network Server from a Java application

trans-unit.source: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

seg-source.mrk: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

target.mrk: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to start the Network Server from a Java application.

seg-source.mrk: There are two ways to start the Network Server from a Java application.

target.mrk: There are two ways to start the Network Server from a Java application.

trans-unit.source: You can include the following line in the <codeph>derby.properties</codeph> file:

target.mrk: You can include the following line in the <codeph>derby.properties</codeph> file:

trans-unit.source: This starts the server on the default port, 1527, listening on <codeph>localhost</codeph> (all interfaces).

seg-source.mrk: This starts the server on the default port, 1527, listening on <codeph>localhost</codeph> (all interfaces).

target.mrk: This starts the server on the default port, 1527, listening on <codeph>localhost</codeph> (all interfaces).
